variants.Description in input context: A30P, A53T and E46K missense mutations in the α-syn gene are associated with rare autosomal dominant forms of familial PD.
A30P, A53T and E46K missense mutations in the α-syn gene are associated with rare autosomal dominant forms of familial PD.

Material used.Description: Cytosolic factors were obtained from brain tissue.

Readout description.Result Description: The presence of brain cytosol enhanced the membrane binding of normal and PD-linked mutant α-syn.
The presence of brain cytosol enhanced the membrane binding of normal and PD-linked mutant α-syn.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-syn was used as a positive control for normal membrane binding.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal membrane binding observed in wild-type α-syn.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Abnormal membrane binding observed in PD-linked mutant α-syn.
